column20: This branch adds undo and redo support to the sheet. Supported operations include all modifications to note, grid and pattern length information.
column21: This branch adds undo and redo support to the sheet. Supported operations include all modifications to note, grid and pattern length information.

column20: This branch adds support for editing sample processors. Note and hit map editors are mostly complete; sample editing capabilities will be extended in a later branch.
column21: This branch adds support for editing sample processors. Note and hit map editors are mostly complete; sample editing capabilities will be extended in a later branch.

column20: This branch hides tracker events from event log completely, as future utilisation of query and auto events will render tracker event logging practically useless from a user's perspective. Also, some playback controls are now better synchronised with audio rendering, and playback from cursor position is fixed.
column21: This branch hides tracker events from event log completely, as future utilisation of query and auto events will render tracker event logging practically useless from a user's perspective. Also, some playback controls are now better synchronised with audio rendering, and playback from cursor position is fixed.

column20: This branch adds a playback position display next to the playback controls.
column21: This branch adds a playback position display next to the playback controls.

column20: This branch adds support for editing event bindings and fixes the infinite event firing bug reported in #310. Also, the new type-generic call event replaces the old type-specific call events.
column21: This branch adds support for editing event bindings and fixes the infinite event firing bug reported in #310. Also, the new type-generic call event replaces the old type-specific call events.

column20: This branch adds a mostly complete notation editor. Individual notes and key mappings may be added, removed and modified; however, it is possible to avoid the bulk of the configuration work by auto-generating note, octave and keymap information from a simpler template.
column21: This branch adds a mostly complete notation editor. Individual notes and key mappings may be added, removed and modified; however, it is possible to avoid the bulk of the configuration work by auto-generating note, octave and keymap information from a simpler template.

column20: This branch adds an editor for general module settings. Currently, it allows the user to edit composition title and authors, global mixing volume and initial random seed. By default, the random seed gets updated between each playback in order to prevent repeated random sequences when working on the composition.
column21: This branch adds an editor for general module settings. Currently, it allows the user to edit composition title and authors, global mixing volume and initial random seed. By default, the random seed gets updated between each playback in order to prevent repeated random sequences when working on the composition.

column20: This branch contains a tuning table editor and a partially rewritten implementation of the tuning tables that manage real-time retuning of pitches. The Real data type of libkunquat has been removed as obsolete.
column21: This branch contains a tuning table editor and a partially rewritten implementation of the tuning tables that manage real-time retuning of pitches. The Real data type of libkunquat has been removed as obsolete.

column20: This branch adds parameter input stream support to the Freeverb processor, which allows for flexible real-time control of the reflectivity and damping of the reverb effect during playback.
column21: This branch adds parameter input stream support to the Freeverb processor, which allows for flexible real-time control of the reflectivity and damping of the reverb effect during playback.

column20: This branch adds a port editor to instruments and effects.
column21: This branch adds a port editor to instruments and effects.

column20: This branch changes the ordering of some processor ports for better consistency. After this branch, existing ports of "official" processors should not change in the file format level (but additional remapping may be introduced later for visual purposes).
column21: This branch changes the ordering of some processor ports for better consistency. After this branch, existing ports of "official" processors should not change in the file format level (but additional remapping may be introduced later for visual purposes).

column13: Importing and exporting support for instruments and effects
column20: This branch adds support for importing and exporting instruments and effects. Support for effects is added to both module and instrument level.
column21: This branch adds support for importing and exporting instruments and effects. Support for effects is added to both module and instrument level.

column20: This branch transitions to Python 3.1 compatible code for all Python code in the Kunquat codebase. As a side effect, the tracker code now interfaces with Qt using a newer API that eliminates Qt-specific wrapper types in Python code. Also, some issues with composition length calculation have been fixed. Finally, the command line player and export utilities work again after a long maintenance break.
column21: This branch transitions to Python 3.1 compatible code for all Python code in the Kunquat codebase. As a side effect, the tracker code now interfaces with Qt using a newer API that eliminates Qt-specific wrapper types in Python code. Also, some issues with composition length calculation have been fixed. Finally, the command line player and export utilities work again after a long maintenance break.

column20: This branch replaces the old audio and UI threads of the tracker program with corresponding processes for better isolation. Taking advantage of this stucture, the tracker now catches and reports assertion failures that occur inside libkunquat.
column21: This branch replaces the old audio and UI threads of the tracker program with corresponding processes for better isolation. Taking advantage of this stucture, the tracker now catches and reports assertion failures that occur inside libkunquat.

column20: This branch changes the tracker to use PySide as the Python wrapper for Qt.
column21: This branch changes the tracker to use PySide as the Python wrapper for Qt.

column20: This branch adds the first iteration of the PADsynth processor. More configuration parameters (including other harmonic profile functions) will be added later, and future backward-incompatible changes are likely.
column21: This branch adds the first iteration of the PADsynth processor. More configuration parameters (including other harmonic profile functions) will be added later, and future backward-incompatible changes are likely.

column20: This branch speeds up the sheet update after order list modifications. There is still room for improvement, but it should be good enough for now.
column21: This branch speeds up the sheet update after order list modifications. There is still room for improvement, but it should be good enough for now.

column20: This branch adds support for importing samples of some common uncompressed and lossless audio formats besides WavPack. No changes were made inside libkunquat; instead, the tracker converts foreign sample formats to WavPack while importing.
column21: This branch adds support for importing samples of some common uncompressed and lossless audio formats besides WavPack. No changes were made inside libkunquat; instead, the tracker converts foreign sample formats to WavPack while importing.

column13: Fix play from cursor with out-of-order songs
column20: This branch fixes issue #471.
column21: This branch fixes issue #471.

column20: This branch applies some clean-up to the fast_exp2 function provided by Ossi. It is also slightly faster than the previous version.
column21: This branch applies some clean-up to the fast_exp2 function provided by Ossi. It is also slightly faster than the previous version.

column13: Optimisations for buffers with constant data
column20: This branch optimises processing of audio buffers that contain constant data, which is common for pitch data in particular. Pitch, force and stream processors mark constant (trailing) regions of their outputs, and processors that accept pitch or force input can take advantage of this information. Additionally, constant pitch is calculated accurately again, which is useful with justly tuned intervals.
column21: This branch optimises processing of audio buffers that contain constant data, which is common for pitch data in particular. Pitch, force and stream processors mark constant (trailing) regions of their outputs, and processors that accept pitch or force input can take advantage of this information. Additionally, constant pitch is calculated accurately again, which is useful with justly tuned intervals.

column13: Fix reverse playback of bidirectionally looped samples
column20: This branch fixes issue #467.
column21: This branch fixes issue #467.

column20: This branch fixes libkunquat compilation with newer versions of gcc that warn against use of sizeof operator with array arguments.
column21: This branch fixes libkunquat compilation with newer versions of gcc that warn against use of sizeof operator with array arguments.

column20: This branch adds a sample view with basic zooming and loop boundary editing functionality.
column21: This branch adds a sample view with basic zooming and loop boundary editing functionality.

column20: This branch should fix issue #503.
column21: This branch should fix issue #503.

column20: This branch adds a separate category for libkunquat tests that are expected to run long. These tests are disabled by default. The Kunquat handle allocation test is in this category, as its duration may be an inconvenience in slow systems.
column21: This branch adds a separate category for libkunquat tests that are expected to run long. These tests are disabled by default. The Kunquat handle allocation test is in this category, as its duration may be an inconvenience in slow systems.

column20: This branch adds more polished icons for the tracker user interface and removes old placeholders.
column21: This branch adds more polished icons for the tracker user interface and removes old placeholders.

column20: This branch fixes some style issues in AA trees and removes needless dynamically allocated iterators.
column21: This branch fixes some style issues in AA trees and removes needless dynamically allocated iterators.

column20: This branch makes the include guard style of the C header files more consistent.
column21: This branch makes the include guard style of the C header files more consistent.

column13: Add clarifying comment to set_data in audio engine
column20: This branch fixes issue #251.
column21: This branch fixes issue #251.

column20: This branch adds support for compiling libkunquat with Clang. Additionally, compiler flags now enable more warnings, and many suspicious parts of the code are fixed as a consequence.
column21: This branch adds support for compiling libkunquat with Clang. Additionally, compiler flags now enable more warnings, and many suspicious parts of the code are fixed as a consequence.

column20: This branch eliminates dynamic memory management associated with the random number generator and fixes several issues in transformations of random value ranges.
column21: This branch eliminates dynamic memory management associated with the random number generator and fixes several issues in transformations of random value ranges.

column20: This branch changes most asserts in libkunquat to release asserts that are compiled even if enable_debug is set to False in options.py. Some asserts in performance-critical areas are converted to debug asserts that are left out when building without debugging.
column21: This branch changes most asserts in libkunquat to release asserts that are compiled even if enable_debug is set to False in options.py. Some asserts in performance-critical areas are converted to debug asserts that are left out when building without debugging.

column20: This branch introduces sound synthesis based on the Karplus-Strong algorithm. Only the bare essentials are included in the new processor type for the time being.
column21: This branch introduces sound synthesis based on the Karplus-Strong algorithm. Only the bare essentials are included in the new processor type for the time being.

column20: This branch makes Travis compile libkunquat with Clang in addition to GCC. Also, all build options in options.py now have a corresponding command line override support.
column21: This branch makes Travis compile libkunquat with Clang in addition to GCC. Also, all build options in options.py now have a corresponding command line override support.

column13: Random initial phase in additive synthesis
column20: This branch adds a boolean parameter that toggles random initial phase in the additive synthesis processor.
column21: This branch adds a boolean parameter that toggles random initial phase in the additive synthesis processor.

column20: This branch adds a dc blocker that centralises the playback output waveform. It is enabled by default.
column21: This branch adds a dc blocker that centralises the playback output waveform. It is enabled by default.

column20: This branch fixes issues #252 and #440.
column21: This branch fixes issues #252 and #440.

column20: This branch extends the Karplus-Strong processor by adding dynamic damp filter control and envelopes for controlling the excitation signal with more flexibility.
column21: This branch extends the Karplus-Strong processor by adding dynamic damp filter control and envelopes for controlling the excitation signal with more flexibility.

column20: This branch adds a processor that converts signals from one value range to another.
column21: This branch adds a processor that converts signals from one value range to another.

column20: This branch implements a basic dynamic range compressor.
column21: This branch implements a basic dynamic range compressor.

column20: This branch changes the way instrument expression settings are applied to notes. Most importantly, the processor filtering associated with expressions is only applied just before audio rendering, enabling the user to properly override default settings with the expression events .xc and .x.
column21: This branch changes the way instrument expression settings are applied to notes. Most importantly, the processor filtering associated with expressions is only applied just before audio rendering, enabling the user to properly override default settings with the expression events .xc and .x.

column20: This branch fixes several issues with processors handling unexpected stream input data, which caused assertion failures, freezes and NaN output data.
column21: This branch fixes several issues with processors handling unexpected stream input data, which caused assertion failures, freezes and NaN output data.

column13: Fix slides with unspecified starting values
column20: This branch fixes issue #538.

column20: This branch fixes issue #539.
column21: This branch fixes issue #539.

column13: Fix slides at arbitrary audio rates
column20: This branch fixes issue #537.
column21: This branch fixes issue #537.

column20: This branch adds a global force shift that is applied to all force setting and sliding events. The default shift adjusts the force levels so that +30 dB in the notation is translated to 0 dB in the audio unit level. This mostly eliminates the need to use negative force values in the notation side. Additionally, force events with high decibel values (> 0 dB in the shifted range) are displayed with a warning colour.
column21: This branch adds a global force shift that is applied to all force setting and sliding events. The default shift adjusts the force levels so that +30 dB in the notation is translated to 0 dB in the audio unit level. This mostly eliminates the need to use negative force values in the notation side. Additionally, force events with high decibel values (> 0 dB in the shifted range) are displayed with a warning colour.

column13: Shortcut for converting between set and slide triggers
column20: This branch adds support for quickly switching from a set trigger to the corresponding slide trigger (provided that one exists) and vice versa.
column21: This branch adds support for quickly switching from a set trigger to the corresponding slide trigger (provided that one exists) and vice versa.

column13: Fix PADsynth pitch range handling with one created sample
column20: This branch fixes issue #549.
column21: This branch fixes issue #549.

column13: Add force slider to instrument test controls

column21: This branch adds a force slider that can be used for testing instruments at different force levels.

column20: This branch improves sample importing process by setting the correct sample frequency and adding a sample name based on the name of the imported file.
column21: This branch improves sample importing process by setting the correct sample frequency and adding a sample name based on the name of the imported file.

column20: This branch adds functionality for converting samples between different bit formats (8, 16, 24 and 32 bits integer, and 32 bits floating-point). Additionally, loading of 24-bit samples is fixed.
column21: This branch adds functionality for converting samples between different bit formats (8, 16, 24 and 32 bits integer, and 32 bits floating-point). Additionally, loading of 24-bit samples is fixed.

column13: Show hit names in hit selector buttons

column21: This branch adds hit names to hit selector buttons (instrument hit editor and sample hit map editor).

column20: This branch fixes issue #547.
column21: This branch fixes issue #547.

column20: This branch adds support for using multiple threads in audio rendering. Currently, sounds of different notes may be synthesised in parallel; other optimisations may follow in later branches.
column21: This branch adds support for using multiple threads in audio rendering. Currently, sounds of different notes may be synthesised in parallel; other optimisations may follow in later branches.

column20: This branch adds support for converting the audio rate of samples.
column21: This branch adds support for converting the audio rate of samples.

column20: This branch fixes some issues with communication between audio and UI processes of the tracker that may have caused hanging and delayed response to libkunquat events in the UI.
column21: This branch fixes some issues with communication between audio and UI processes of the tracker that may have caused hanging and delayed response to libkunquat events in the UI.

column20: This branch fixes issue #566, some issues with sample loop editor and the list of package dependencies in INSTALL.
column21: This branch fixes issue #566, some issues with sample loop editor and the list of package dependencies in INSTALL.

column20: This branch adds support for testing the output of individual voice signal processors inside an instrument.
column21: This branch adds support for testing the output of individual voice signal processors inside an instrument.

column20: This branch adds support for testing individual samples in the sample editor. The underlying support code in libkunquat allows similar testing capabilities to be added to other processor types should the need arise.
column21: This branch adds support for testing individual samples in the sample editor. The underlying support code in libkunquat allows similar testing capabilities to be added to other processor types should the need arise.

column13: Support importing of several samples at once
column20: This branch adds support for selecting multiple samples in the file dialog that is opened when importing samples.
column21: This branch adds support for selecting multiple samples in the file dialog that is opened when importing samples.

column20: This branch adds support for persistent user settings in the tracker.
column21: This branch adds support for persistent user settings in the tracker.

column13: Audio quality groundwork in additive synthesis processor
column20: This branch reduces aliasing artifacts produced by the additive synthesis processor. The internal representation of the base waveforms should also be useful later when adding sinc interpolation support. This branch also includes a (hopefully) correct implementation of forward and inverse FFT for real-valued input (however, the PADsynth processor is still using the old inverse FFT implementation).
column21: This branch reduces aliasing artifacts produced by the additive synthesis processor. The internal representation of the base waveforms should also be useful later when adding sinc interpolation support. This branch also includes a (hopefully) correct implementation of forward and inverse FFT for real-valued input (however, the PADsynth processor is still using the old inverse FFT implementation).

column20: This branch fixes issue #575.

column20: This branch fixes issue #581.
column21: This branch fixes issue #581.

column20: This branch fixes issue #579.
column21: This branch fixes issue #579.

column21: This branch migrates PADsynth FFT code to the more correct FFTPACK implementation and removes the obsolete irfft module.

column21: This branch fixes issue #585.

column13: Fix locale issues in kunquat-player and kunquat-export
column20: This branch fixes issue #585.
column21: That's a good point and I'll keep that in mind when dealing with error messages in the future. But I think I'll merge this one as is.

column20: This branch introduces a new customised look for the tracker with user-configurable colour palette. Also, the branch fixes some freezing issues with pop-up widget updates.
column21: This branch introduces a new customised look for the tracker with user-configurable colour palette. Also, the branch fixes some freezing issues with pop-up widget updates.

column20: This branch removes the Qt event pump thread from the tracker as Qt signals in/between multiple threads seem to cause stability issues in PySide (and the extra thread is unnecessary in any case).
column21: This branch removes the Qt event pump thread from the tracker as Qt signals in/between multiple threads seem to cause stability issues in PySide (and the extra thread is unnecessary in any case).

column20: This branch fixes some crashes and inconsistent behaviour in some order list editing operations.
column21: This branch fixes some crashes and inconsistent behaviour in some order list editing operations.

column20: This branch adds a new compact view of input controls that contains the notation and octave selectors but not the typewriter. The main splitter is removed as obsolete. It should still be possible to hide the sheet by resizing the main window.
column21: This branch adds a new compact view of input controls that contains the notation and octave selectors but not the typewriter. The main splitter is removed as obsolete. It should still be possible to hide the sheet by resizing the main window.

column20: This branch fixes some spelling inconsistencies.
column21: This branch fixes some spelling inconsistencies.

column20: This branch fixes issue #593.
column21: This branch fixes issue #593.

column20: This branch adds a visible playback cursor to the sheet. It is possible to have the sheet follow the playback cursor or the edit cursor during playback. Note that, in order to avoid confusion, sheet editing operations are currently disabled completely when following playback cursor. Recording functionality will be revisited in a later branch.
column21: This branch adds a visible playback cursor to the sheet. It is possible to have the sheet follow the playback cursor or the edit cursor during playback. Note that, in order to avoid confusion, sheet editing operations are currently disabled completely when following playback cursor. Recording functionality will be revisited in a later branch.

column13: bzip2 as the default file compression format
column20: This branch removes the file compression format extensions from the names of Kunquat files, uses bzip2 compression when saving Kunquat files and only accepts bzip2-compressed or uncompressed Kunquat files when loading. Also included is a new Python convenience module that is used for loading Kunquat module files.
column21: This branch removes the file compression format extensions from the names of Kunquat files, uses bzip2 compression when saving Kunquat files and only accepts bzip2-compressed or uncompressed Kunquat files when loading. Also included is a new Python convenience module that is used for loading Kunquat module files.

column20: This branch eliminates a lot of boilerplate code in the view code of the tracker UI. Also, grid-related toolbar items are now placed next to each other in the sheet toolbar.
column21: This branch eliminates a lot of boilerplate code in the view code of the tracker UI. Also, grid-related toolbar items are now placed next to each other in the sheet toolbar.

column20: This branch adds a progress bar display for long tasks performed by the tracker. Also, some interaction issues on the main window (#352, #438) should now be fixed.
column21: This branch adds a progress bar display for long tasks performed by the tracker. Also, some interaction issues on the main window (#352, #438) should now be fixed.

column20: This branch adds support for highpass filtering in the Filter processor.
column21: This branch adds support for highpass filtering in the Filter processor.

column20: This branch simplifies the interfaces for stretching envelopes in time. As a result, the input ports used for time stretching have a more general-purpose scale, and the Karplus-Strong processor now has a separate input port for this purpose. Also, the force envelope and force input ports are now gone from the envelope generator, as these features didn't make much sense in the current design.
column21: This branch simplifies the interfaces for stretching envelopes in time. As a result, the input ports used for time stretching have a more general-purpose scale, and the Karplus-Strong processor now has a separate input port for this purpose. Also, the force envelope and force input ports are now gone from the envelope generator, as these features didn't make much sense in the current design.

column13: Fix starting of stream oscillation with initial parameters
column20: This branch fixes usage of the initial configuration of oscillation state in the stream processor.
column21: This branch fixes usage of the initial configuration of oscillation state in the stream processor.

column13: Fix uninitialised memory in PADsynth sample creation
column20: This branch fixes memory initialisation in PADsynth sample creation.
column21: This branch fixes memory initialisation in PADsynth sample creation.

column20: This branch introduces the Slope processor, which calculates the slope of the signal it receives.
column21: This branch introduces the Slope processor, which calculates the slope of the signal it receives.

column20: This branch redefines the interface for triggering envelope processing inside the envelope generator processor. First, it is now possible to trigger the envelope at both the start and the release of a note (it has only been possible to select one of the two previously). More significantly, the envelope can also be triggered by changes in an input signal fed to the new input port of the processor. Finally, random changes may now be applied to the output range used for each triggering of the envelope.
column21: This branch redefines the interface for triggering envelope processing inside the envelope generator processor. First, it is now possible to trigger the envelope at both the start and the release of a note (it has only been possible to select one of the two previously). More significantly, the envelope can also be triggered by changes in an input signal fed to the new input port of the processor. Finally, random changes may now be applied to the output range used for each triggering of the envelope.

column20: This branch adds support for zooming in envelopes with time axis.
column21: This branch adds support for zooming in envelopes with time axis.

column20: This branch removes all envelope-related functionality from the Karplus-Strong processor. All related functionality can be configured more flexibly with other processors.
column21: This branch removes all envelope-related functionality from the Karplus-Strong processor. All related functionality can be configured more flexibly with other processors.

column20: This branch adds support for asymmetric gain compression.
column21: This branch adds support for asymmetric gain compression.

column21: This branch fixes sheet view performance after undoing or redoing a change in the sheet.

column20: This branch fixes the termination logic of notes, optimises away some cases of voice state processing that don't affect the audio output, and cleans up processor type identification in playback code.
column21: This branch fixes the termination logic of notes, optimises away some cases of voice state processing that don't affect the audio output, and cleans up processor type identification in playback code.

column20: This branch adds a separate build configuration option for toggling debug assertions (disabled by default), adding more flexibility for controlling performance and debugability of libkunquat. Also, AA tree validation code now uses debug assertion.
column21: This branch adds a separate build configuration option for toggling debug assertions (disabled by default), adding more flexibility for controlling performance and debugability of libkunquat. Also, AA tree validation code now uses debug assertion.

column20: This branch improves performance of sheet rendering (and reduces memory footprint a little) during playback. Occasional spikes in rendering time still occur, but updates that were very slow previously (like changing from one pattern to the next) should be mostly ironed out. Also, the sheet now updates faster (not smooth but at least usable) when notation or note force shifting is changed.

column20: This branch introduces syntactic sugar for setting name/value pairs with stream control, device and environment variable events. For example, instead of setting a new value for stream 'foo' with triggers [.sn 'foo'] and [.s 5], it is now possible to use the more convenient syntax [.s:foo 5] which has equivalent behaviour in every way (.s:foo does not introduce a new event type, 'foo' is set as the new active name in the channel, and any event bindings to .sn and .s still apply).
column21: This branch introduces syntactic sugar for setting name/value pairs with stream control, device and environment variable events. For example, instead of setting a new value for stream 'foo' with triggers [.sn 'foo'] and [.s 5], it is now possible to use the more convenient syntax [.s:foo 5] which has equivalent behaviour in every way (.s:foo does not introduce a new event type, 'foo' is set as the new active name in the channel, and any event bindings to .sn and .s still apply).

automatic test run in Docker:
docker build -t kunquat_test_runner .

column13: Add AUR packaging scripts [DO NOT MERGE]
column20:
This adds packaging scripts for Arch linux (Arch User Repository), one for releases, one for git. It also makes the release.sh script automatically update the shasum and version in the packaging scripts.
Currently, Kunquat cannot be added to AUR, since build fails on newer versions of GCC.

column13: Add AUR packaging scripts [DO NOT MERGE]
column20:
This adds packaging scripts for Arch linux (Arch User Repository), one for releases, one for git. It also makes the release.sh script automatically update the shasum and version in the packaging scripts.

column21: Do you know how the Arch Linux process works? I did some work on Ubuntu packages at one point. If I recall correctly the source packages that had Debian packaging files were problematic since Debian would typically want to add the on top of the source package afterwards.

column13: Add AUR packaging scripts [DO NOT MERGE]
column20:
This adds packaging scripts for Arch linux (Arch User Repository), one for releases, one for git. It also makes the release.sh script automatically update the shasum and version in the packaging scripts.
Currently, Kunquat cannot be added to AUR, since build fails on newer versions of GCC.
column21:
The packaging is for AUR, which hosts neither binaries nor sources. Rather, it only contains the PKGBUILD scripts which fetch and build the sources on the end user's machine when installing. As AUR is not the primary package repository for Arch, it does not have super strict criteria for package inclusion.
If you're interested about the specifics, see https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Arch_User_Repository
My PR has two scripts, one for releases and one for git master. It would be possible (and likely a good idea) to only include the git version, so the PKGBUILD would not have to be submitted to AUR on each release.

column13: Add AUR packaging scripts [DO NOT MERGE]
column20:
This adds packaging scripts for Arch linux (Arch User Repository), one for releases, one for git. It also makes the release.sh script automatically update the shasum and version in the packaging scripts.
Currently, Kunquat cannot be added to AUR, since build fails on newer versions of GCC.
column21:
Arch has also updated to Python 3.7.0 which has breaking changes.
gcc in repos is currently on 8.2.0 fwiw
EDIT: Fixes in #800 and #811 mean this PKGBUILD does build now, with minor changes..
As is, the PKGBUILD will redundantly build Kunquat twice.
Once in build(), and another time in package() steps, as both involve running ./make.py
Either build() can be omitted, or package() needs to copy the files to $PKGDIR manually.
Upstream fabricate.py source'd script, changed in #810 so the gist one needs to be removed or changed to include the python 3.7 compatibility.

column13: Interleaved work buffers and signal processing optimisation pass
column20: This branch adds more flexible buffer allocation schemes for processors that benefit from interleaved multichannel buffers. In practice, the performance increase is currently quite modest in cases where the main bottleneck is mixing in short sections (see #834); however, many processor implementations are now at least simpler, and further optimisations should be possible. Also, many performance-critical sections are now optimised for SSE2/SSE4.1. Finally, signal processing now works without explicit clearing of buffers, which fixes #821.
column21: This branch adds more flexible buffer allocation schemes for processors that benefit from interleaved multichannel buffers. In practice, the performance increase is currently quite modest in cases where the main bottleneck is mixing in short sections (see #834); however, many processor implementations are now at least simpler, and further optimisations should be possible. Also, many performance-critical sections are now optimised for SSE2/SSE4.1. Finally, signal processing now works without explicit clearing of buffers, which fixes #821.

column20:
This branch eliminates global signal processing breakpoints at triggers that only access the state of a single channel (issue #834). The added complexity in the sequencer may reduce overall performance slightly; however, the new implementation performs significantly better with large bursts of near-simultaneous triggers, which, when combined with a large number of active notes, are usually the most demanding parts in audio rendering.
In addition to optimisation, this branch also fixes voice group integrity issues when running out of voices (issue #561). Also, a couple of rendering bugs related to tempo and oscillation speed slides were discovered and fixed during the development.
Note that this branch does not implement multithreaded audio rendering. That will be re-introduced later.
column21:
This branch eliminates global signal processing breakpoints at triggers that only access the state of a single channel (issue #834). The added complexity in the sequencer may reduce overall performance slightly; however, the new implementation performs significantly better with large bursts of near-simultaneous triggers, which, when combined with a large number of active notes, are usually the most demanding parts in audio rendering.
In addition to optimisation, this branch also fixes voice group integrity issues when running out of voices (issue #561). Also, a couple of rendering bugs related to tempo and oscillation speed slides were discovered and fixed during the development.
Note that this branch does not implement multithreaded audio rendering. That will be re-introduced later.

column20: This branch makes creating new audio units more pleasant by adding essential internals. New instruments produce audible output when played, and new effects connect their inputs to their outputs by default. Also, creation of new audio units now take place in a single transaction, which will help if we want to add undo support to these operations in the future.
column21: This branch makes creating new audio units more pleasant by adding essential internals. New instruments produce audible output when played, and new effects connect their inputs to their outputs by default. Also, creation of new audio units now take place in a single transaction, which will help if we want to add undo support to these operations in the future.

column20: This branch improves the behaviour of the order list editor. Most importantly, it adds a confirmation dialog for pattern (as well as song) removal so that the user cannot accidentally remove the entire composition by simply having their cat step on the Delete button. Also, the insert buttons now add the new pattern/song after the selected one, which is usually the desired result. Finally, a signalling bug on song removal was discovered and fixed.
column21: This branch improves the behaviour of the order list editor. Most importantly, it adds a confirmation dialog for pattern (as well as song) removal so that the user cannot accidentally remove the entire composition by simply having their cat step on the Delete button. Also, the insert buttons now add the new pattern/song after the selected one, which is usually the desired result. Finally, a signalling bug on song removal was discovered and fixed.

column20: This branch adds proper scaling for many lines in the sheet that were previously hardcoded to 1 pixel width, and it also fixes some incorrect colours used with the editing cursor.
column21: This branch adds proper scaling for many lines in the sheet that were previously hardcoded to 1 pixel width, and it also fixes some incorrect colours used with the editing cursor.

column20: This branch fixes the sizes of various combo box lists to properly show all the options without unnecessary scrolling.
column21: This branch fixes the sizes of various combo box lists to properly show all the options without unnecessary scrolling.

column20: This branch fixes some widgets that were not updated properly when font size changed in the tracker UI.

column20: This branch optimises some parts of the UI to do less work in idle state to bring idle CPU usage further down.
column21: This branch optimises some parts of the UI to do less work in idle state to bring idle CPU usage further down.

column13: Lower upper bound of filter cutoff to prevent instability
column20: This branch fixes instability in the filter processor with SSE optimisations.
column21: This branch fixes instability in the filter processor with SSE optimisations.

column13: Select a test note expression if available when opening an instrument view

column20: This branch adds phase and randomisation controls to the PADsynth processor to improve consistency when needed. The PADsynth parameter object format number has been incremented in order to provide clear error messages if the user tries to load a new PADsynth processor in Kunquat 0.9.3 or earlier.
column21: This branch adds phase and randomisation controls to the PADsynth processor to improve consistency when needed. The PADsynth parameter object format number has been incremented in order to provide clear error messages if the user tries to load a new PADsynth processor in Kunquat 0.9.3 or earlier.

column13: Fix data conversion of audio unit keys when importing an audio unit

column20: This branch fixes incorrect tempo settings in the player state that caused stream oscillators to update incorrectly.
column21: This branch fixes incorrect tempo settings in the player state that caused stream oscillators to update incorrectly.

column20: This branch disables the new sample pitch rounding with the PADsynth format of Kunquat 0.9.3 and earlier.
column21: This branch disables the new sample pitch rounding with the PADsynth format of Kunquat 0.9.3 and earlier.

column13: Eliminate execution of inaccessible processors inside voice signal plans
column20: This fixes crashes caused by attempting to play unconnected voice signal processors and improves resource usage with some instrument configurations.
column21: This fixes crashes caused by attempting to play unconnected voice signal processors and improves resource usage with some instrument configurations.

column13: Deactivate final zero signal of multiplier voice processors
column20: This branch adds an optimisation that prevents indefinite calculation of certain voice signals that are multiplied by zero and thus do not contribute to audio output.
column21: This branch adds an optimisation that prevents indefinite calculation of certain voice signals that are multiplied by zero and thus do not contribute to audio output.

column20: This branch reverts most of the buffer interleaving introduced recently. It turned out that strictly single-channel buffers work better in most real-world cases, and the cases where interleaving helps do not justify the added complexity. Buffer interleaving is now used in the library interface level only.
column21: This branch reverts most of the buffer interleaving introduced recently. It turned out that strictly single-channel buffers work better in most real-world cases, and the cases where interleaving helps do not justify the added complexity. Buffer interleaving is now used in the library interface level only.

column20: This branch replaces the old fast tangent function with a new implementation that is simpler, more accurate, and probably faster.
column21: This branch replaces the old fast tangent function with a new implementation that is simpler, more accurate, and probably faster.

column20:
This branch reintroduces parallel voice group rendering, which greatly reduces rendering time at high levels of voice utilisation. Local channel event processing is also shared among worker threads. Mixed signal processing is left single-threaded, as parallelising that is not effective in most common cases. As an added bonus, the auto-detection of CPU cores now works properly in non-hyperthreading systems.
The libkunquat source is now compiled as C11, as the parallel voice group rendering makes use of C11 atomics.
column21:
This branch reintroduces parallel voice group rendering, which greatly reduces rendering time at high levels of voice utilisation. Local channel event processing is also shared among worker threads. Mixed signal processing is left single-threaded, as parallelising that is not effective in most common cases. As an added bonus, the auto-detection of CPU cores now works properly in non-hyperthreading systems.
The libkunquat source is now compiled as C11, as the parallel voice group rendering makes use of C11 atomics.

column20: This branch adds support for custom audio rate used internally by the Karplus-Strong processor, which can help make the processor behave more consistently across a wider range of system audio rates.
column21: This branch adds support for custom audio rate used internally by the Karplus-Strong processor, which can help make the processor behave more consistently across a wider range of system audio rates.
